headline: Private reserves offer more; Kruger offers value
summary: Kruger National Park allows self-drive and offers excellent value. Adjacent private reserves like Sabi Sands offer off-road driving, night drives, walking safaris, and fewer vehicles at sightings. The private reserve experience is significantly better but costs 3-5x more. The choice depends on whether the enhanced experience justifies the premium.

assumptions.text: Private reserves offer off-road, night drives, and walking safaris not available in Kruger.
Private reserves cost 3-5x more than Kruger self-drive or rest camps.
Wildlife populations are shared between Kruger and adjacent private reserves.

gains: Kruger: Large park with diverse habitats
Private: Night drives and walking safaris
losses: Kruger: On-road only, no night drives

change_conditions: If budget is primary concern, Kruger self-drive provides exceptional value.
If leopard sightings are priority, Sabi Sands has the best odds in Africa.
If wanting the full safari experience with guides, private reserves deliver.
If combining with self-drive adventure, Kruger fits the approach better.
